snippet: The outburst of anger, which spread to Ha Tinh Province in central Vietnam from the country’s south, included brutal attacks on Chinese, South Korean and Taiwanese factories.
abstract: Scores of Chinese laborers are brutally attacked by Vietnamese mob as violence in southern Vietnam spreads to Ha Tinh Province over territorial dispute in the South China Sea.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and CHAU DOAN
byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller contributed reporting from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: The outburst of anger, which spread to Ha Tinh Province in central Vietnam from the country’s south, included brutal attacks on Chinese, South Korean and Taiwanese factories.

headline.main: Anti-Chinese Violence Convulses Vietnam, Pitting Laborers Against Laborers
headline.print_headline: Anti-Chinese Violence Convulses Vietnam, Pitting Laborers Against Laborers
